definition: knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together

sentences.english: You've all ganged up against me, it's not fair.
sentences.chinese: 你们一帮人结伙反对我，这不公平。

sentences.english: The grouses in groups tied the partner to go to the marsh land.
sentences.chinese: 松鸡们都成群结伙地到洼地去了。

sentences.english: Teenage boys tend to go about in groups.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的男孩喜欢成群结伙地四处闲逛。

sentences.english: The older children were always ganging up on the little ones.
sentences.chinese: 年龄大的孩子经常结伙欺负小孩子。

sentences.english: Dogs run in packs, and domesticated dogs are grieving when separated from their owners for any length of time.
sentences.chinese: 狗喜欢成帮结伙，家养的狗被与主人隔离后就会哀伤。

sentences.english: When you going to start the gang and turn robbers?
sentences.chinese: 你打算什么时候结伙当强盗？

sentences.english: Gangs of youths went on the rampage in the city yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 成群结伙的年轻人昨天在城里横冲直撞。

sentences.english: We visited the new comer without ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 邻居们结伙反对新来者。

sentences.english: Children like to gang each other.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们喜欢成群结伙相互攻击。

definition: to roam all over the place/to go into every nook and corner/to infiltrate/(of criminals, enemies etc) to be on the run/to flee and try to hide
to take advantage of sb in an unguarded moment (idiom)/to take sb by surprise
